PERSONA:
karen denise thompson is a 42-year-old, born-again protestant, married woman living in the metropolitan area of baton rouge, louisiana, with her husband and two children. born and raised in the united states, karen identifies as a white non-hispanic and has lived in the south her entire life. she graduated with a high school diploma from baker high school in 2001 and has not pursued further formal education. 

karen works as a part-time administrative assistant at a local healthcare clinic, earning $38,000 per year, while her husband works full-time as a mechanical engineer at a nearby chemical plant, earning $50,000 annually. their combined income falls within the $70,000 to $80,000 range. they rent a three-bedroom, 1,500 sq. ft. house in a middle-class neighborhood for $1,400 per month.

karen is an avid internet user, frequently browsing social media platforms, checking news, and shopping online several times a day. although she doesn't volunteer, she donates to her local church and participates in community activities through her children's school. she values her role as a homemaker and mother, dedicating significant time to her family.

as a devout protestant, karen attends church services at the first baptist church of baton rouge once a week with her family. she identifies as a conservative republican, listing her top economic concerns as jobs and economic growth, smaller government, and lower taxes. her political leanings are shaped by her conservative values, faith, and personal experiences. on election days, karen casts her ballot at the designated polling station near her home, an activity she views as a civic duty.

karen strongly supports conservative policies that promote economic growth and job creation, which she believes benefit her family and the local community. she and her husband rely heavily on their dual incomes to support their family and are keenly interested in policies affecting middle-class families, such as affordable healthcare and education. karen consistently votes republican in national and local elections, owing to the party's alignment with her values and economic priorities.
